title: Anthocyanin attenuates pulmonary arterial hypertension and associated heart failure via improving mitochondrial function through Nrf2-dependent mechanism.
abstract: Mitochondrial dysfunction of pulmonary vascular endothelial cells is one of the important pathogenesis of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). Anthocyanin can protect mitochondrial function, but whether anthocyanin can prevent PAH and its related mechanism has not been reported.
journal: Clinical and experimental hypertension (New York, N.Y. : 1993)
